entry.name: None
entry.description: Tweening behavior class used in Tween and AdvTween classes. This class has only static methods.
entry.see: Tween, AdvTween, Back, Elastic, Quad, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, Sine, Expo, Circ

constructor.name: None
constructor.description: Tweening behavior class used in Tween and AdvTween classes. This class has only static methods.
constructor.see: Tween, AdvTween, Back, Elastic, Quad, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, Sine, Expo, Circ

method.name: easeNone
method.returnDesc: A number used by Tween and AdvTween.
method.description: Linear easing tweening behavior. This is one of Robert penner's easing functions. document.write(window.location.toString().indexOf("mtd")>-1?getBehaviorGraph('None'):"(See graph)").
method.see: Tween, AdvTween, Back, Elastic, Quad, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, Sine, Expo, Circ

entry.name: Tween
entry.description: An interpolation feature used to animate visual elements from a CSS property. For simultaneous tweenings of more than one CSS property, create several Tween instances, respectively related to each CSS property.
entry.exampleCode: new Tween("userPicture", "width", Quad.prototype.easeInOut, 100, 200, 10, false, {visibility: 'visible'}); //Object's width tweening that lasts 10 frames new Tween("userPicture", "opacity", Quad.prototype.easeInOut, 0, 1, f2m(getFPS(), 10)/1000, true); //Object's opacity tweening that lasts the equivalent of 10 frames in seconds

constructor.name: Tween
constructor.description: An interpolation feature used to animate visual elements from a CSS property. For simultaneous tweenings of more than one CSS property, create several Tween instances, respectively related to each CSS property.

attribute.name: DOMObjId
attribute.description: The DOM Element id

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: The CSS property to be tweened

attribute.name: easeType
attribute.description: The tween behavior function. None, Back, Elastic, Quad, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, Sine, Expo and Circ are examples of the available behaviors.

attribute.name: initValue
attribute.description: Initial value

attribute.name: finalValue
attribute.description: Final value

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: The duration of the tween in frames

attribute.name: useSeconds
attribute.description: If true, duration is considered as seconds. Otherwise, duration is considered as frames

attribute.name: xtraProp
attribute.description: CSS properties to be set before the tweening starts

constructor.exampleCode: new Tween("userPicture", "width", Quad.prototype.easeInOut, 100, 200, 10, false, {visibility: 'visible'}); //Object's width tweening that lasts 10 frames new Tween("userPicture", "opacity", Quad.prototype.easeInOut, 0, 1, f2m(getFPS(), 10)/1000, true); //Object's opacity tweening that lasts the equivalent of 10 frames in seconds

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the tweening.
method.see: brk, AdvTween

attribute.name: callOMFF
attribute.description: Determines whether or not the onMotionFinished event is triggered after stopping the tweening.

method.name: brk
method.description: A more abrupt way to interrupt the tweening. In order to detect whether or not the tweening has been stopped when onMotionFinished is triggered, stop is more recommended.
method.see: stop, AdvTween

attribute.name: callOMFF
attribute.description: Determines whether or not the onMotionFinished event is triggered after breaking the tweening.

event.name: onMotionFinished
event.description: Event triggered when tweening is finished.

entry.name: AdvTween
entry.description: A Tween based feature used to interpolate a value that can be used to animate one or more elements.

constructor.name: AdvTween
constructor.description: A Tween based feature used to interpolate a value that can be used to animate one or more elements.

attribute.name: easeType
attribute.description: The tween behavior function. None, Back, Elastic, Quad, Cubic, Quartic, Quintic, Sine, Expo and Circ are examples of the available behaviors.

attribute.name: initValue
attribute.description: Initial value

attribute.name: finalValue
attribute.description: Final value

attribute.name: duration
attribute.description: The duration of the tween in frames

attribute.name: useSeconds
attribute.description: If true, duration is considered as seconds. Otherwise, duration is considered as frames

attribute.name: theFunction
attribute.description: The function to be executed every since the value changes. The current state of the interpolated value can be retrieved by the first parameter of this function.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the tweening. Its usage is similar to Tween's stop method.

attribute.name: callOMFF
attribute.description: Determines whether or not the onMotionFinished event is triggered after stopping the tweening.

event.name: onMotionFinished
event.description: Event usage similar to Tween's onMotionFinished.

entry.name: Spriter
entry.description: A sprite animator feature. Given the sprite image, total number of tiles, number of tiles per line and tile dimensions, this feature produces an animation using FPS variable as the FPS rate.
entry.exampleCode: //Creating a 64x64 animation area from a sprite image with 16 tiles that loops infinitely and begin always from frame 10 new Spriter("spritePlace", 64, 64, "spriteImage.png", 4, 16, -1, 10, true);

constructor.name: Spriter
constructor.description: A sprite animator feature. Given the sprite image, total number of tiles, number of tiles per line and tile dimensions, this feature produces an animation using FPS variable as the FPS rate.

attribute.name: DOMObjId
attribute.description: The DOM Element id

attribute.name: tileWidth
attribute.description: The width in pixels of the tile

attribute.name: tileHeight
attribute.description: The height in pixels of the tile

attribute.name: spriteImageFile
attribute.description: The url to the sprite image

attribute.name: tilesPerLine
attribute.description: The number of tiles (frames) per line

attribute.name: totalTiles
attribute.description: The total number of tiles (frames)

attribute.name: loops
attribute.description: The number of times the animation will loop. For looping infinitely, one can use -1

attribute.name: fromFrame
attribute.description: The frame offset to start the animation

attribute.name: keepFromFrame
attribute.description: If true, when the animation loops, it starts from fromFrame. Otherwise, it starts from the beginning

constructor.exampleCode: //Creating a 64x64 animation area from a sprite image with 16 tiles that loops infinitely and begin always from frame 10 new Spriter("spritePlace", 64, 64, "spriteImage.png", 4, 16, -1, 10, true);

method.name: stop
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Stops playhead displaying the current frame.
method.see: play, gotoAndPlay, gotoAndStop, isStopped

method.name: play
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Activates the playhead displaying the animation from the current frame. If the animation is already playing, nothing happens.
method.see: stop, gotoAndPlay, gotoAndStop, isStopped

method.name: isStopped
method.returnDesc: If true, the animation is stopped. Otherwise, the animation is playing.
method.description: Indicates whether or not the animation is stopped.
method.see: play, stop, gotoAndPlay, gotoAndStop

method.name: gotoAndStop
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Goes to a frame and stops the animation.
method.see: play, stop, gotoAndPlay, isStopped

method.name: gotoAndPlay
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Goes to a frame and activates the playhead.
method.see: play, stop, gotoAndStop, isStopped

event.name: onFrameChange
event.description: Event triggered when current frame changes. Methods gotoAndPlay and gotoAndStop also trigger this event.

attribute.name: frame
attribute.description: The new current frame number.

entry.name: AJAX
entry.description: An Asynchronous Javascript and XML (AJAX) feature. It performs HTTP requests through Javascript XMLHttpRequest object.

constructor.name: AJAX
constructor.description: An Asynchronous Javascript and XML (AJAX) feature. It performs HTTP requests through Javascript XMLHttpRequest object.

attribute.name: requestType
attribute.description: The request method (GET or POST)

attribute.name: requestPage
attribute.description: A page to be requested

attribute.name: isAsync
attribute.description: True for an asynchronous request, false for a synchronous request

attribute.name: inputParameters
attribute.description: The parameters to be sent to request page. Object properties, as well as their values are internally converted and respectively assigned to parameters and values of a query string.

attribute.name: responseManagerFunction
attribute.description: The function to handle the obtained response. This function is similar to Javascript XMLHttpRequest.onreadystatechange event.

attribute.name: additionalHeaders
attribute.description: Additional request headers to be added to the HTTP request.

method.name: setRequestType
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Sets the request type of an AJAX instance.
method.see: AJAX, getRequestType

attribute.name: requestType
attribute.description: The request method to be set (GET or POST)

method.name: getRequestType
method.returnDesc: A string containing a request type (GET or POST)
method.description: Gets the current request type of an AJAX instance.
method.see: AJAX, setRequestType

method.name: setRequestPage
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Sets the request page of an AJAX instance.
method.see: AJAX, getRequestPage

attribute.name: requestPage
attribute.description: A page to be requested

method.name: getRequestPage
method.returnDesc: A string containing a request page
method.description: Gets the current request page of an AJAX instance.
method.see: AJAX, setRequestPage

method.name: setAsync
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Sets whether or not the request page of an AJAX instance is asynchronous.
method.see: AJAX, isAsync

attribute.name: isAsync
attribute.description: True for an asynchronous request, false for a synchronous request

method.name: isAsync
method.returnDesc: A boolean that indicates whether or not the request is asynchronous
method.description: Gets a boolean that indicates whether or not the request is asynchronous.
method.see: AJAX, setAsync

method.name: setInputParameters
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Sets the query string parameters of an AJAX instance. In order to append parameters, avoid the replacement, one can use addParameters method. Since there is no getter for input parameters, one can check the current state of the data to be sent through the HTTP request using getQueryString method.
method.see: AJAX, getQueryString, addParameters

attribute.name: parametersObject
attribute.description: The parameters to be sent to request page. Object properties, as well as their values are internally converted and respectively assigned to parameters and values of a query string.

method.name: addParameters
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Appends query string parameters of an AJAX instance. In order to avoid unnecessary accumulation of parameters, one can use setInputParameters method. Since there is no getter for input parameters, one can check the current state of the data to be sent through the HTTP request using getQueryString method.
method.see: AJAX, getQueryString, setInputParameters

attribute.name: parametersObject
attribute.description: The parameters to be sent to request page. Object properties, as well as their values are internally converted and respectively assigned to parameters and values of a query string.

method.name: clearParameters
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Clears the parameters currently stored. Since there is no getter for input parameters, one can check the current state of the data to be sent through the HTTP request using getQueryString method.
method.see: AJAX, getQueryString, setInputParameters, addParameters

method.name: getQueryString
method.returnDesc: A query string
method.description: Gets a query string of an AJAX instance. This query string contains every data to be sent through the HTTP request.
method.see: AJAX, getQueryString, setInputParameters, addParameters, clearParameters

method.name: setResponseManagerFunction
method.returnDesc: Nothing
method.description: Sets the function to be called when responses from HTTP requests are received.
method.see: AJAX, getResponseManagerFunction

attribute.name: rmFunction
attribute.description: The function to be called for handling responses from HTTP requests.

method.name: getResponseManagerFunction
method.returnDesc: A function.
method.description: Gets the function currently assigned to an AJAX instance for handling responses from HTTP requests.
method.see: AJAX, setResponseManagerFunction

method.name: validate
method.returnDesc: A boolean value
method.description: A validator to check whether or not the attributes of an AJAX instance are correctly adjusted to perform HTTP requests.
method.see: AJAX, makeRequest

method.name: makeRequest
method.returnDesc: A boolean value that indicates whether or not the HTTP request
method.description: Performs an HTTP request based on the attributes of an AJAX instance. This method internally calls validate method before issuing an HTTP request.
method.see: AJAX, validate

method.name: getResponseText
method.returnDesc: A string containing a response from an HTTP request
method.description: Gets the response arasing from an HTTP request. Commonly used in synchronous HTTP requests.
method.see: AJAX, getResponseXML, makeRequest

method.name: getResponseXML
method.returnDesc: A XML Object
method.description: Gets the response arasing from an HTTP request in XML Object format. Commonly used in synchronous HTTP requests. This structure can be explored by accessing childNodes or using methods such as getElementsByTagName().
method.see: AJAX, getResponseText, makeRequest

entry.name: canRunSWF
entry.description: Variable that indicates whether or not SWF animations can be run into the browser. The underlying algorithm was taken from Adobe Forum.

entry.name: FPS
entry.description: Variable that stores the current FPS rate, used in Tween and Spriter features.
entry.see: Tween, AdvTween, Spriter

entry.name: Drag.X_AXIS
entry.description: X axis constraint used in startDrag function.

entry.name: Drag.Y_AXIS
entry.description: Y axis constraint used in startDrag function.

entry.name: Drag.BOTH_AXIS
entry.description: X and Y axis constraint used in startDrag function.

entry.name: Drag.ABSOLUTE
entry.description: Positioning mode used in startDrag function.

entry.name: Drag.RELATIVE
entry.description: Positioning mode used in startDrag function.
An alias for document.getElementById(id).

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: The DOM element ID.

entry.name: getFPS
entry.description: Gets the current value set to FPS variable.
entry.exampleCode: alert(getFPS()); //If FPS variable has not been set yet, it should display 30
entry.see: FPS, setFPS

entry.name: setFPS
entry.description: Set a new value to FPS variable.
entry.exampleCode: setFPS(40); //setting the fps to 40 alert(getFPS()); //It should display 40
entry.see: FPS, getFPS, resetFPS

attribute.name: newFPS
attribute.description: The new FPS rate to be set. See FPS variable for more information.

entry.name: resetFPS
entry.description: Sets FPS variable to its default value (30).
entry.see: FPS, getFPS, setFPS

entry.name: f2m
entry.description: Converts frames at a FPS rate to milliseconds.
entry.see: m2f, resetFPS

attribute.name: fps
attribute.description: A FPS rate

attribute.name: frames
attribute.description: The number of frames

entry.name: m2f
entry.description: Converts milliseconds to a numbers of frames, from a FPS rate.
entry.see: f2m, resetFPS

attribute.name: fps
attribute.description: A FPS rate

attribute.name: milli
attribute.description: The millisseconds duration

entry.name: dec2hex
entry.description: Converts a number from base 10 to base 16.

attribute.name: num
attribute.description: The base 10 number

entry.name: hex2dec
entry.description: Converts a number from base 16 to base 10.

attribute.name: num
attribute.description: The base 16 number

entry.name: getStyleFromObject
entry.returnDesc: A string containing the specified style.
entry.description: Function that retrieves a style (CSS property) from a DOM Element.

attribute.name: objId
attribute.description: The DOM element ID.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: The CSS property to be retrieved

entry.name: startDrag
entry.returnDesc: Returns always false, avoiding the text selection.
entry.description: Function that enables dragging DOM elements. Always called at mousedown event. Use stopDrag function to stop dragging.
entry.see: stopDrag, onDrag

attribute.name: mouseDownEventObject
attribute.description: The event variable obtained with mousedown event.

attribute.name: objId
attribute.description: The DOM element ID.

attribute.name: keepZindex
attribute.description: If true, the z-index CSS property is kept. Otherwise, the next highest value is assigned to this element. Default is true.

attribute.name: axisConstraint
attribute.description: Axis restriction constraint. Constants Drag.X_AXIS, Drag.Y_AXIS or Drag.BOTH_AXIS should be used. Default is Drag.BOTH_AXIS.

attribute.name: relativity
attribute.description: Indicates whether the positioning is relative or absolute. Constants Drag.RELATIVE or Drag.ABSOLUTE should be used. Default is Drag.ABSOLUTE.

entry.name: stopDrag
entry.description: Function that stops a DOM element dragging, initiated by startDrag function. Always called at onmouseup event.
entry.see: startDrag, onDrag

entry.name: onDrag
entry.returnDesc: true for allowing, or false for avoiding the next dragged position.
entry.description: Event triggered when a DOM element is dragged using startDrag function. This event carries one argument, which its structure is similar to onmousedown event, carrying two more properties: event.nextX and event.nextY.
entry.see: startDrag, stopDrag

entry.name: onDragAfter
entry.description: Event triggered after a DOM element is dragged using startDrag function. This event carries one argument, which its structure is similar to onmouseup event.
entry.see: startDrag, stopDrag

entry.name: getWeekDayFromDate
entry.returnDesc: A number related to a week day. From 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday)
entry.description: Function that returns the week day of a date.

attribute.name: d
attribute.description: The day of the date

attribute.name: m
attribute.description: The month of the date

attribute.name: y
attribute.description: The 4-digit year of the date

entry.name: drawCalendar
entry.returnDesc: A HTML string of the calendar if asText is set as true. Otherwise, nothing is returned
entry.description:
Function that build the HTML code of a calendar sheet based on a specified date. The figure below illustrates the HTML DIV element hierarchy, as well as the object (to be used as an argument for parameter eventos) properties that carry its corresponding CSS classes.
Figure 1 - HTML DIV element hierarchy and object properties related to its CSS classes

attribute.name: dia
attribute.description: The day of the date

attribute.name: mes
attribute.description: The month of the date

attribute.name: ano
attribute.description: The 4-digit year of the date

attribute.name: estilos
attribute.description: An object containing CSS class names for the HTML elements to be built.

attribute.name: eventos
attribute.description: An array of day numbers (Example 2) or calendar event objects (Example 1).

attribute.name: asText
attribute.description: If true, the HTML code is returned as a String. Otherwise, the output is written by document.write().

attribute.name: onDateSelected
attribute.description: A function to be triggered when a day of the calendar is selected.

entry.name: newXML
entry.description: A faster way to open XML files.

attribute.name: xmlDir
attribute.description: Url of the XML file.

entry.name: SWFObject
entry.returnDesc: An HTML string of the specified SWF file to be embedded.
entry.description: A faster way to obtain the HTML code of embedded SWF files.

attribute.name: swfDir
attribute.description: Url of the SWF file.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Width of the embedded area.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: Height of the embedded area.

entry.name: drawSWF
entry.description: A faster way to embed SWF files as HTML. This function makes usage of SWFObject and document.write functions.

attribute.name: swfDir
attribute.description: Url of the SWF file.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Width of the embedded area.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: Height of the embedded area.
